metadata.name: Setup Company Voice Guide for Brand Consistency
metadata.description: Create and configure Company Voice Guide in Dropbox Dash (or custom AI tools) to ensure all AI-generated content matches brand voice, tone, and terminology
prerequisites: Access to existing brand guidelines, style guides, or marketing materials
Understanding of company brand personality and values
Authority to define brand voice standards
Access to Dropbox Dash (for Dash implementation) or alternative AI tool with custom instructions

outputs: Voice Guide integrated with AI tools (Dash, ChatGPT, Copilot, etc.)
Team trained on using Voice Guide
AI-generated content matches brand standards (70-90% first-draft accuracy)
Reduced content revision cycles (30-50% time savings)

steps.description: Collect existing brand guidelines, style guides, marketing copy, customer-facing content, and support templates. Review for patterns in tone, terminology, and style
what_to_collect: Website copy (homepage, product pages, about page)

steps.description: Analyze materials to identify 3-5 core brand personality traits (e.g., friendly, innovative, trustworthy, playful, professional, empathetic). Document with examples
steps.output: 3-5 documented brand personality traits with supporting examples

steps.description: Specify tone for different contexts (marketing vs. support vs. internal docs). Define formality level, emotional tone, and context-specific adjustments
steps.output: Tone guidelines documented for 3-5 content contexts

example_guidelines.marketing: Warm and conversational, optimistic but not salesy
example_guidelines.customer_support: Empathetic and helpful, professional but friendly
example_guidelines.product_docs: Clear and instructional, technical but accessible
example_guidelines.internal_comms: Transparent and collaborative, informal but respectful

steps.description: Create lists of preferred terms, forbidden words, and industry jargon handling. Be specific about word substitutions (e.g., 'customers' not 'users', 'help' not 'assist')
steps.output: Terminology guide with 15-30 word choice rules
categories: Acronym policy (spell out on first use)

steps.description: Write 5-10 side-by-side examples showing on-brand vs. off-brand content. This is the most important step for AI learning. Cover different content types and common mistakes
steps.success_criteria: Examples cover diverse scenarios (marketing, support, docs, error messages, CTAs)
steps.example_format: ✅ On-brand: 'We're here to help!' | ❌ Off-brand: 'Our support team will assist you with your inquiry' | Why: Prefer warm, direct language over formal, passive constructions

steps.description: Organize all sections into comprehensive Voice Guide document. Use clear headings, bullet points, and examples. Aim for 2-5 pages (concise but complete)
steps.output: Complete Company Voice Guide document (2-5 pages)

steps.description: Add Voice Guide to AI tools your team uses. For Dropbox Dash: upload to Company Voice Guide feature. For ChatGPT: add to Custom Instructions. For Copilot: add to .github/copilot-instructions.md. For Claude: create Project with guide
steps.output: Voice Guide integrated with 2-3 primary AI tools

integration_methods.dropbox_dash: Settings → Company Voice Guide → Upload document
integration_methods.claude_projects: Create Project → Add guide to project knowledge
integration_methods.generic: Prepend guide to every prompt (manual but universal)

steps.description: Test Voice Guide integration by generating 5-10 sample content pieces (marketing copy, support response, product description). Evaluate adherence to brand voice
steps.output: Test results showing 70-90% brand voice adherence
test_scenarios: Draft a customer support response to billing question
Create social media post about company milestone
Write error message for failed file upload
Draft email to inactive users encouraging re-engagement

steps.description: Review test outputs for brand voice violations. Identify patterns in mistakes (e.g., AI still using 'users' instead of 'customers'). Strengthen Voice Guide with more explicit rules or additional examples
steps.output: Voice Guide v1.1 with refinements based on AI output testing

steps.description: Share Voice Guide with team via Slack, email, or team meeting. Explain how to use with AI tools. Provide examples of improved outputs. Designate 'brand champion' to maintain guide
steps.output: Team trained on Voice Guide usage; guide accessible in shared location
training_topics: How to use with AI tools (Dash, ChatGPT, etc.)
Examples of on-brand vs. off-brand AI outputs
How to report Voice Guide gaps or suggestions

quality_checklist: Voice Guide is 2-5 pages (concise but comprehensive)
3-5 brand personality traits documented with examples
5-10 before/after examples included (critical for AI learning)
Voice Guide integrated with 2+ AI tools team uses
Test outputs show 70-90% brand voice adherence
Team trained on Voice Guide usage
Guide accessible in shared location (Google Docs, Notion, wiki)
Brand champion designated for ongoing maintenance

voice_guide_template.section_1_brand_personality: We are [TRAIT 1], [TRAIT 2], and [TRAIT 3]. We are never [ANTI-TRAIT 1] or [ANTI-TRAIT 2]. Example: Our homepage says '[EXAMPLE]' not '[COUNTER-EXAMPLE]'.
voice_guide_template.section_2_tone: Marketing: [DESCRIPTION]. Support: [DESCRIPTION]. Docs: [DESCRIPTION]. Adjust for urgency: [GUIDELINES].
voice_guide_template.section_5_formatting: Headers: [STYLE]. Lists: [WHEN TO USE]. Bold/Italic: [USAGE]. Emojis: [POLICY].

time_savings_analysis.without_voice_guide: Manual editing of AI content for brand voice: 15-30 minutes per piece
time_savings_analysis.with_voice_guide: Minimal editing (mostly factual checks): 5-10 minutes per piece
time_savings_analysis.quality_improvement: 85% reduction in off-brand content (measured by review flags)

creation: Start with 5-10 core principles (expand later if needed)
Prioritize examples over rules (AI learns better from examples)
Use before/after comparisons (highly effective for AI)
Test with real AI tools before company-wide rollout
Version the guide (v1.0, v2.0) and date stamp
maintenance: Review quarterly or after major brand refreshes
Track common AI violations (add rules to address patterns)
Gather team feedback (what's missing? what's unclear?)
Update examples with real-world AI outputs

common_mistakes_to_avoid: Too long (10+ pages that no one reads)
All rules, no examples (AI needs examples to learn)
Set it and forget it (guide needs periodic updates)
Not testing with AI tools before rollout
